{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which of the following is not used as a disinfectant, we need to understand the properties and uses of each option. A. 1-2% Cetrimide: Cetrimide is a quaternary ammonium compound that is commonly used as a disinfectant and antiseptic. It is effective against a wide range of microorganisms. B. 100% Alcohol: Alcohol, specifically isopropyl alcohol or ethanol, is commonly used as a disinfectant. It is effective against many bacteria and viruses. C. 2% Lysol: Lysol is a brand of disinfectant that contains various active ingredients, including quaternary ammonium compounds. It is commonly used for disinfecting surfaces and killing germs. D. 5% Chloroxylene: Chloroxylene is not a commonly used disinfectant. It is not a recognized active ingredient in disinfectants and is not known for its disinfecting properties. Based on this information, the option that is not used as a disinfectant is D. 5% Chloroxylene.", "answer_choice": "D"}
